technology.optimizationH2: Pillar 2: The Optimization Engine — Thompson Sampling
technology.optimizationIntro: Campana uses Thompson Sampling, a Bayesian approach to the explore-exploit tradeoff, for bid and budget optimization. This is the same class of algorithm used by Amazon for product recommendations and by Google internally for ad serving (though they don't use it to optimize YOUR campaigns — that would reduce their revenue).
technology.optimizationWhat: What it does in plain language:
optimizationPoints: Models each keyword/campaign as a probability distribution (not a single number)
Uncertainty is explicit — new keywords with little data have wide distributions
Balances exploring uncertain keywords vs. exploiting known high performers
Uses Beta distributions for conversion rates and Gamma distributions for cost modeling
Runs 1,000 Monte Carlo simulations per optimization cycle

whyMattersItems.solution: Thompson Sampling works with 10-15 by modeling uncertainty explicitly
Hierarchical priors from similar accounts across your agency provide a warm start
The model updates daily as new performance data arrives
Every recommendation comes with the underlying confidence interval and data window

technology.pipelineIntro: Campana's agent runs a structured 4-stage pipeline. This isn't a prompt sent to an LLM hoping for the best. Each stage has defined inputs, outputs, and validation.
technology.stage1Desc: Pull data from Google Ads API and Meta Marketing API. Rate-limited, retried with exponential backoff, normalized into a platform-agnostic format.
technology.stage2Desc: Run performance trend analysis (14-day windows), anomaly detection (CPA spikes, CTR drops), search term classification, and budget pacing checks.
technology.stage3Desc: Thompson Sampling generates bid, budget, and keyword recommendations. Each recommendation includes a confidence score (0.00–1.00), reasoning in plain language, and expected impact estimate.
technology.stage4Desc: Takes a state snapshot (for rollback), validates against guardrails, applies the change via platform API, verifies the change was applied correctly.
technology.guardrailsIntro: Every optimization passes through 6 independent safety checks before it even reaches your approval queue.
layer1Items: Max bid increase: configurable, default 20-30% per change
Max budget increase: configurable, default 15-20% per change
No keyword modified twice within 48-hour cooldown period
layer2Items: Hard daily spend cap per campaign
Portfolio-level budget cap across all campaigns
Pacing checks prevent burning through budget before peak hours
layer3Items: No bid changes on keywords with <50 impressions
Platform learning phases respected (Meta: 50 conversions/week before changes)
layer4Items: Automatic halt if >100 clicks with 0 conversions detected
Flags possible broken tracking pixel for human review
layer5Items: If CPA spikes >50% within 24 hours of a change → auto-pause, alert user
If 3 consecutive platform API errors → pause automation, notify
If daily budget exceeded 110% → emergency pause
layer6Items: Every change stores the previous value (current_value → proposed_value)
One-click rollback in the approval queue
Rollback available for 30 days after execution
technology.copywritingIntro: The third pillar isn't about automating bid changes — it's about helping you think smarter and create better.
aiCopyItems: Headline generation — AI suggests 3-5 headline variants optimized for CTR based on your existing top performers
Description alternatives — Platform-specific copy adapted to Google vs Meta best practices
Creative refresh suggestions — When an ad's performance declines, AI proposes new angles to test
Language model fine-tuned on ad copy — Not generic ChatGPT, but a model trained on millions of high-converting ads
strategyItems: Cross-platform budget allocation — "Campaign A delivers 1.8x ROAS on Google but 2.4x on Meta — shift 20% budget to Meta"
Portfolio-level insights — Not just "this keyword underperforms," but "these 5 campaigns share a trend suggesting seasonal slowdown"
Proactive recommendations — "Your Search campaign consistently outperforms Display — consider reallocating 15% of Display budget"
Trend detection — Historical pattern analysis flags upcoming opportunities or risks before they impact performance
technology.reasoningH2: AI Reasoning — Not a Black Box
technology.reasoningIntro: Most ad optimization tools tell you what they changed. Campana tells you WHY.
reasoningItems: What: "Increase bid on keyword 'SaaS CRM free trial' from PLN 4.20 to PLN 4.60"
Why: "This keyword has a CPA of PLN 38 vs. target PLN 45 over the last 14 days with 23 conversions. Increasing the bid by 9.5% should capture more impression share while staying within target."
Confidence: 0.78 (78%) — based on data volume and distribution tightness
Expected impact: "Estimated +15% impressions, CPA expected to stay under target"
technology.reasoningClose: You can approve with full context, reject with understanding, and the system learns from your decisions.
technology.crossClientIntro: When you manage 10, 30, or 100 client accounts, Campana learns across all of them — while keeping each client's data completely isolated.
crossClientItems: Hierarchical Bayesian priors pool anonymized performance patterns across your agency's accounts
New client campaigns start with warm priors from similar accounts (not cold-start)
Individual client data never crosses tenant boundaries (isolated at the database level)
The more accounts your agency manages, the smarter the optimization becomes for each one
technology.crossClientClose: This is why Campana works with 10-15 conversions/month — it doesn't start from zero.
technology.infraIntro: Campana is built on battle-tested open-source technology, not a fragile prototype.

infraItems.why: ACID compliance, JSONB for flexible action data
OAuth state, rate limiting, session data

technology.infraClose: Every API call is logged. Every action has an audit trail. Every error is tracked and recoverable.

meta.title: Campana FAQ — Common Questions About AI Ad Optimization | campana.io
meta.description: Answers to common questions about Campana: how it works, pricing, security, Smart Bidding compatibility, data handling, and more.

questions.q: How is Campana different from Google Smart Bidding or Meta Advantage+?
questions.a: Campana is a complete marketing command center, not just a bidding tool. You get: (1) a unified dashboard showing all campaigns across Google + Meta, (2) AI optimization for bids and budgets with full transparency, (3) AI copywriting assistance for ad headlines and descriptions, and (4) strategic insights like cross-platform budget allocation. Platform tools optimize for platform revenue (more spend = more profit) and trap you in separate dashboards. Campana is independent — we optimize for your CPA and ROAS targets across both platforms.

questions.q: Will this conflict with Smart Bidding if I'm already using it?
questions.a: Yes. You should turn off Smart Bidding on campaigns managed by Campana — running both will cause them to fight each other. Campana replaces Smart Bidding with a more transparent approach that works better for lower-volume accounts.

questions.q: What ad platforms do you support?
questions.a: Currently Google Ads and Meta (Facebook/Instagram) Ads. LinkedIn Ads, TikTok, and Amazon Sponsored Ads are on our roadmap.

questions.q: Does Campana show all my campaigns in one place?
questions.a: Yes. The unified dashboard displays all your Google Ads and Meta campaigns side by side with normalized metrics (spend, conversions, CPA, ROAS, CTR). No more switching tabs or copying data into spreadsheets to compare cross-platform performance.

questions.q: How much time could this save?
questions.a: Our goal is to reduce the time spent reviewing campaigns from 2-3 hours of manual dashboard checking and spreadsheet analysis down to a 10-15 minute review of AI-proposed optimizations. We're still measuring real-world time savings with early users.

questions.q: What if I don't like a recommendation?
questions.a: Reject it with one click. Campana learns from your rejections and adjusts future recommendations.

questions.q: Can Campana write ad copy for me?
questions.a: Yes. The AI copywriting engine generates 3-5 headline and description variants optimized for CTR based on your existing top performers and platform best practices. You review and approve the ones you like.

questions.q: How does the AI make decisions? Is it just ChatGPT?
questions.a: No. Campana uses Thompson Sampling (a Bayesian statistical method) for bid and budget optimization — not a generic language model. For copywriting, we use a language model fine-tuned specifically on ad copy, not generic ChatGPT. The optimization math is a purpose-built statistical engine.

questions.q: How does cross-client learning work without sharing data?
questions.a: We pool anonymized statistical priors (performance distributions) across your agency's accounts. The raw data from each client stays strictly isolated — only aggregate patterns are shared to improve cold-start performance for new campaigns.

questions.q: What happens during the free trial?
questions.a: Full access to the Starter tier for 14 days, no credit card required. The agent analyzes and proposes optimizations but won't execute them until you subscribe. This lets you judge recommendation quality risk-free.

questions.q: Do you charge based on ad spend?
questions.a: No. Flat monthly fee based on number of accounts. This aligns our incentives — we succeed when your ROI improves, not when you spend more.
Yes. No long-term contracts. Cancel anytime. Data retained for 30 days in case you want to reactivate.

questions.q: What if the AI makes a mistake?
questions.a: Every action stores rollback data (the previous value). One-click revert. Guardrails prevent extreme changes (e.g., max 20% bid increase). Circuit breakers auto-pause if performance degrades.
OAuth 2.0, Fernet encryption (AES-128-CBC) for all tokens, tenant isolation at the database level, GDPR compliant.

questions.q: Do you access my billing data?
questions.a: No. We only access campaign performance data, keyword data, and ad metadata. Never billing, payment methods, or personal data from your ads.

questions.q: How much ad spend do I need?
questions.a: Minimum 5 000 PLN/month per account. Below that, there isn't enough conversion volume for data-driven optimization to outperform manual management.

questions.q: How does Campana handle seasonal changes like Black Friday?
questions.a: The Thompson Sampling model automatically adapts to recent trends. You can also manually adjust CPA/ROAS targets before high-traffic periods.

questions.q: What technology stack does Campana use?
questions.a: FastAPI (Python) backend, PostgreSQL database, Redis for caching, Clerk for authentication.

meta.title: Privacy Policy — Campana
meta.description: Learn how Campana handles your data: what we collect, how we store it, your GDPR rights, and our data retention policies.

sections.title: What Data We Collect
sections.content: We collect account performance data (campaign metrics, keyword data, ad creative metadata), user account information (name, email, company), and usage analytics (feature usage, session data). This data is necessary to provide our optimization and dashboard services.

sections.title: What Data We Don't Collect
sections.content: We never collect billing data, payment methods, or personal data from your ad viewers. We do not access your Google or Meta account passwords — all connections use OAuth 2.0.

sections.title: How We Store Data
sections.content: All data is encrypted at rest using Fernet (AES-128-CBC) encryption. Data is stored in tenant-isolated PostgreSQL databases hosted on EU-based infrastructure (Supabase). Each agency/business has a completely separate data space.

sections.title: Third-Party Processors
sections.content: We use Supabase (database hosting), Clerk (authentication), and Upstash (caching). Data Processing Agreements are in place with all processors. All processors are GDPR compliant.

sections.title: Data Retention
sections.content: Your data is actively maintained while your subscription is active. After cancellation, data is retained for 30 days to allow reactivation, then permanently deleted.

sections.title: Your GDPR Rights
sections.content: You have the right to: access your data, rectify inaccurate data, request deletion, export your data (portability), restrict processing, and object to processing. Contact hello@campana.io for any data requests.

sections.title: Cookies
sections.content: We use minimal cookies: essential functionality cookies (session, language preference) and privacy-friendly analytics (Plausible). No third-party tracking cookies are used.

sections.title: Contact
sections.content: For data protection inquiries, contact us at hello@campana.io.
